description: Integers k such that abs(e^(Pi*sqrt(n)) - k) < 0.01 for some n.
comments: Old name of sequence was "Integers that are very close to values of exp(Pi*sqrt(n))", which left "very close" undefined. _Robert G. Wilson v_ resolved this problem on Feb 28 2006 with the comment that "'Very close' means to within 0.01." - _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Mar 21 2015
references: H. M. Stark, An Introduction to Number Theory. Markham, Chicago, 1970, p. 179.
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{e = Exp[Pi*Sqrt[n]]}, Abs[e - Round[e]]]; Round(AT) Exp[Pi*Sqrt(AT)Select[Range[ -1, 200], f(AT)# < 10^(-2) &]] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 28 2006 *)
author: Roy Williams Clickery (roy(AT)ccsf.caltech.edu)
extensions: New name, based on Feb 28 2006 comment from _Robert G. Wilson v_, from _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Mar 21 2015
